profitbricks_volume.description: Allows you to create or remove a volume from a ProfitBricks datacenter. This module has a dependency on profitbricks >= 1.0.0

count.description:
Default: 1

The number of volumes you wish to create.

datacenter.description: The datacenter in which to create the volumes.

name.description: The name of the volumes. You can enumerate the names using auto_increment.

subscription_user.description: The ProfitBricks username. Overrides the PB_SUBSCRIPTION_ID environement variable.

licence_type.description:
Default: UNKNOWN

The licence type for the volume. This is used when the image is non-standard.

image.description: The system image ID for the volume, e.g. a3eae284-a2fe-11e4-b187-5f1f641608c8. This can also be a snapshot image ID.

instance_ids.description: list of instance ids, currently only used when state='absent' to remove instances.

subscription_password.description: THe ProfitBricks password. Overrides the PB_PASSWORD environement variable.

state.description:
Default: present

create or terminate datacenters

wait_timeout.description:
Default: 600

how long before wait gives up, in seconds

auto_increment.description:
Default: True

Whether or not to increment a single number in the name for created virtual machines.

wait.description:
Default: yes

wait for the datacenter to be created before returning

disk_type.description:
Default: HDD

The disk type. Currently only HDD.

size.description:
Default: 10

The size of the volume.

redhat_subscription.description: Manage registration and subscription to the Red Hat Network entitlement platform.

username.description: Red Hat Network username

server_hostname.description:
Default: Current value from C(/etc/rhsm/rhsm.conf) is the default

Specify an alternative Red Hat Network server

consumer_name.description: Name of the system to register, defaults to the hostname

consumer_type.description: The type of unit to register, defaults to system

org_id.description: Organisation ID to use in conjunction with activationkey

consumer_id.description: References an existing consumer ID to resume using a previous registration for this system. If the  system's identity certificate is lost or corrupted, this option allows it to resume using its previous identity and subscriptions. The default is to not specify a consumer ID so a new ID is created.

state.description:
Default: present

whether to register and subscribe (C(present)), or unregister (C(absent)) a system

pool.description:
Default: ^$

Specify a subscription pool name to consume.  Regular expressions accepted.

activationkey.description: supply an activation key for use with registration

server_insecure.description:
Default: Current value from C(/etc/rhsm/rhsm.conf) is the default

Enable or disable https server certificate verification when connecting to C(server_hostname)

password.description: Red Hat Network password

rhsm_baseurl.description:
Default: Current value from C(/etc/rhsm/rhsm.conf) is the default

Specify CDN baseurl

autosubscribe.description: Upon successful registration, auto-consume available subscriptions

capabilities.description: This module manipulates files privileges using the Linux capabilities(7) system.

capability.description: Desired capability to set (with operator and flags, if state is C(present)) or remove (if state is C(absent))

path.description: Specifies the path to the file to be managed.

state.description:
Default: present

Whether the entry should be present or absent in the file's capabilities.

cap.description: Desired capability to set (with operator and flags, if state is C(present)) or remove (if state is C(absent))

hall.description: The M(hall) module connects to the U(https://hall.com) messaging API and allows you to deliver notication messages to rooms.

msg.description: The message you wish to deliver as a notifcation

room_token.description: Room token provided to you by setting up the Ansible room integation on U(https://hall.com)

picture.description: The full URL to the image you wish to use for the Icon of the message. Defaults to U(http://cdn2.hubspot.net/hub/330046/file-769078210-png/Official_Logos/ansible_logo_black_square_small.png?t=1421076128627)

subversion.description: Deploy given repository URL / revision to dest. If dest exists, update to the specified revision, otherwise perform a checkout.

username.description: --username parameter passed to svn.

executable.description: Path to svn executable to use. If not supplied, the normal mechanism for resolving binary paths will be used.

force.description:
Default: no

If C(yes), modified files will be discarded. If C(no), module will fail if it encounters modified files. Prior to 1.9 the default was `yes`.

name.description: The subversion URL to the repository.

repository.description: The subversion URL to the repository.

dest.description: Absolute path where the repository should be deployed.

repo.description: The subversion URL to the repository.

switch.description:
Default: yes

If C(no), do not call svn switch before update.

version.description:
Default: HEAD

Specific revision to checkout.

export.description:
Default: no

If C(yes), do export instead of checkout/update.

password.description: --password parameter passed to svn.

revision.description:
Default: HEAD

Specific revision to checkout.

group_by.description: Use facts to create ad-hoc groups that can be used later in a playbook.

key.description: The variables whose values will be used as groups

rax_mon_notification.description: Create or delete a Rackspace Cloud Monitoring notification that specifies a channel that can be used to communicate alarms, such as email, webhooks, or PagerDuty. Rackspace monitoring module flow | rax_mon_entity -> rax_mon_check -> *rax_mon_notification* -> rax_mon_notification_plan -> rax_mon_alarm

state.description: Ensure that the notification with this C(label) exists or does not exist.

details.description: Dictionary of key-value pairs used to initialize the notification. Required keys and meanings vary with notification type. See http://docs.rackspace.com/cm/api/v1.0/cm-devguide/content/ service-notification-types-crud.html for details.

label.description: Defines a friendly name for this notification. String between 1 and 255 characters long.

gitlab_group.description:
When the group does not exists in Gitlab, it will be created.
When the group does exists and state=absent, the group will be deleted.

verify_ssl.description:
Default: True

When using https if SSL certificate needs to be verified.

name.description: Name of the group you want to create.

login_user.description: Gitlab user name.

server_url.description: Url of Gitlab server, with protocol (http or https).

state.description:
Default: present

create or delete group.
Possible values are present and absent.

login_password.description: Gitlab password for login_user

path.description:
The path of the group you want to create, this will be server_url/group_path
If not supplied, the group_name will be used.

validate_certs.description:
Default: True

When using https if SSL certificate needs to be verified.

junos_config.description:
The M(junos_config) module provides an abstraction for working with the configuration running on remote devices.  It can perform operations that influence the configuration state.
This module provides an implementation for configuring Juniper JUNOS devices.  The configuration statements must start with either `set` or `delete` and are compared against the current device configuration and only changes are pushed to the device.

comment.description:
Default: configured by junos_config

The C(comment) argument specifies a text string to be used when committing the configuration.  If the C(confirm) argument is set to False, this argument is silently ignored.

rollback.description: The C(rollback) argument instructs the module to rollback the current configuration to the identifier specified in the argument.  If the specified rollback identifier does not exist on the remote device, the module will fail.  To rollback to the most recent commit, set the C(rollback) argument to 0

confirm.description: The C(confirm) argument will configure a time out value for the commit to be confirmed before it is automatically rolled back.  If the C(confirm) argument is set to False, this argument is silently ignored.  If the value for this argument is set to 0, the commit is confirmed immediately.

lines.description: The path to the config source.  The source can be either a file with config or a template that will be merged during runtime.  By default the task will search for the source file in role or playbook root folder in templates directory.

replace.description: The C(replace) argument will instruct the remote device to replace the current configuration hierarchy with the one specified in the corresponding hierarchy of the source configuraiton loaded from this module.

zeroize.description: The C(zeroize) argument is used to completely ssantaize the remote device configuration back to initial defaults.  This argument will effectively remove all current configuration statements on the remote device

uptimerobot.description: This module will let you start and pause Uptime Robot Monitoring

monitorid.description: ID of the monitor to check.

state.description: Define whether or not the monitor should be running or paused.

rax_mon_check.description: Create or delete a Rackspace Cloud Monitoring check associated with an existing rax_mon_entity. A check is a specific test or measurement that is performed, possibly from different monitoring zones, on the systems you monitor. Rackspace monitoring module flow | rax_mon_entity -> *rax_mon_check* -> rax_mon_notification -> rax_mon_notification_plan -> rax_mon_alarm

entity_id.description: ID of the rax_mon_entity to target with this check.

check_type.description: The type of check to create. C(remote.) checks may be created on any rax_mon_entity. C(agent.) checks may only be created on rax_mon_entities that have a non-null C(agent_id).

target_alias.description: One of `target_alias` and `target_hostname` is required for remote.* checks, but prohibited for agent.* checks. Use the corresponding key in the entity's `ip_addresses` hash to resolve an IP address to target.

target_hostname.description: One of `target_hostname` and `target_alias` is required for remote.* checks, but prohibited for agent.* checks. The hostname this check should target. Must be a valid IPv4, IPv6, or FQDN.

label.description: Defines a label for this check, between 1 and 64 characters long.

disabled.description: If "yes", ensure the check is created, but don't actually use it yet.

state.description: Ensure that a check with this C(label) exists or does not exist.

period.description: The number of seconds between each time the check is performed. Must be greater than the minimum period set on your account.

details.description: Additional details specific to the check type. Must be a hash of strings between 1 and 255 characters long, or an array or object containing 0 to 256 items.

timeout.description: The number of seconds this check will wait when attempting to collect results. Must be less than the period.

monitoring_zones_poll.description: Comma-separated list of the names of the monitoring zones the check should run from. Available monitoring zones include mzdfw, mzhkg, mziad, mzlon, mzord and mzsyd. Required for remote.* checks; prohibited for agent.* checks.

metadata.description: Hash of arbitrary key-value pairs to accompany this check if it fires. Keys and values must be strings between 1 and 255 characters long.

ohai.description: Similar to the M(facter) module, this runs the I(Ohai) discovery program (U(http://wiki.opscode.com/display/chef/Ohai)) on the remote host and returns JSON inventory data. I(Ohai) data is a bit more verbose and nested than I(facter).

ops_template.description: The OpenSwitch platform provides a library for pushing JSON structured configuration files into the current running-config.  This module will read the current configuration from OpenSwitch and compare it against a provided candidate configuration. If there are changes, the candidate configuration is merged with the current configuration and pushed into OpenSwitch

src.description: The path to the config source.  The source can be either a file with config or a template that will be merged during runtime.  By default the task will search for the source file in role or playbook root folder in templates directory.

config.description: The module, by default, will connect to the remote device and retrieve the current running-config to use as a base for comparing against the contents of source.  There are times when it is not desirable to have the task get the current running-config for every task in a playbook.  The I(config) argument allows the implementer to pass in the configuruation to use as the base config for comparision.

force.description: The force argument instructs the module to not consider the current devices running-config.  When set to true, this will cause the module to push the contents of I(src) into the device without first checking if already configured.

backup.description: When this argument is configured true, the module will backup the running-config from the node prior to making any changes. The backup file will be written to backups/ in the root of the playbook directory.

win_environment.description:
Uses .net Environment to set or remove environment variables and can set at User, Machine or Process level.
User level environment variables will be set, but not available until the user has logged off and on again.

state.description:
Default: present

present to ensure environment variable is set, or absent to ensure it is removed

name.description:
Default: no default

The name of the environment variable

value.description:
Default: no default

The value to store in the environment variable. Can be omitted for state=absent

level.description:
Default: no default

The level at which to set the environment variable.
Use 'machine' to set for all users.
Use 'user' to set for the current user that ansible is connected as.
Use 'process' to set for the current process.  Probably not that useful.

os_ironic_inspect.description: Requests Ironic to set a node into inspect state in order to collect metadata regarding the node. This command may be out of band or in-band depending on the ironic driver configuration. This is only possible on nodes in 'manageable' and 'available' state.

mac.description:
Default: None

unique mac address that is used to attempt to identify the host.

ironic_url.description:
Default: None

If noauth mode is utilized, this is required to be set to the endpoint URL for the Ironic API. Use with "auth" and "auth_type" settings set to None.

name.description:
Default: None

unique name identifier to identify the host in Ironic.

timeout.description:
Default: 1200

A timeout in seconds to tell the role to wait for the node to complete introspection if wait is set to True.

uuid.description:
Default: None

globally unique identifier (UUID) to identify the host.

apt.description: Manages I(apt) packages (such as for Debian/Ubuntu).

dpkg_options.description:
Default: force-confdef,force-confold

Add dpkg options to apt command. Defaults to '-o "Dpkg::Options::=--force-confdef" -o "Dpkg::Options::=--force-confold"'
Options should be supplied as comma separated list

upgrade.description:
Default: no

If yes or safe, performs an aptitude safe-upgrade.
If full, performs an aptitude full-upgrade.
If dist, performs an apt-get dist-upgrade.
Note: This does not upgrade a specific package, use state=latest for that.

force.description:
Default: no

If C(yes), force installs/removes.

name.description: A package name, like C(foo), or package specifier with version, like C(foo=1.0). Name wildcards (fnmatch) like C(apt*) and version wildcards like C(foo=1.0*) are also supported.  Note that the apt-get commandline supports implicit regex matches here but we do not because it can let typos through easier (If you typo C(foo) as C(fo) apt-get would install packages that have "fo" in their name with a warning and a prompt for the user.  Since we don't have warnings and prompts before installing we disallow this.  Use an explicit fnmatch pattern if you want wildcarding)

install_recommends.description: Corresponds to the C(--no-install-recommends) option for I(apt). C(yes) installs recommended packages.  C(no) does not install recommended packages. By default, Ansible will use the same defaults as the operating system. Suggested packages are never installed.

package.description: A package name, like C(foo), or package specifier with version, like C(foo=1.0). Name wildcards (fnmatch) like C(apt*) and version wildcards like C(foo=1.0*) are also supported.  Note that the apt-get commandline supports implicit regex matches here but we do not because it can let typos through easier (If you typo C(foo) as C(fo) apt-get would install packages that have "fo" in their name with a warning and a prompt for the user.  Since we don't have warnings and prompts before installing we disallow this.  Use an explicit fnmatch pattern if you want wildcarding)

autoclean.description: If C(yes), remove unused dependency packages for all module states except I(build-dep).

purge.description: Will force purging of configuration files if the module state is set to I(absent).

allow_unauthenticated.description:
Default: no

Ignore if packages cannot be authenticated. This is useful for bootstrapping environments that manage their own apt-key setup.

state.description:
Default: present

Indicates the desired package state. C(latest) ensures that the latest version is installed. C(build-dep) ensures the package build dependencies are installed.

autoremove.description: If C(yes), remove unused dependency packages for all module states except I(build-dep).

update_cache.description: Run the equivalent of C(apt-get update) before the operation. Can be run as part of the package installation or as a separate step.

pkg.description: A package name, like C(foo), or package specifier with version, like C(foo=1.0). Name wildcards (fnmatch) like C(apt*) and version wildcards like C(foo=1.0*) are also supported.  Note that the apt-get commandline supports implicit regex matches here but we do not because it can let typos through easier (If you typo C(foo) as C(fo) apt-get would install packages that have "fo" in their name with a warning and a prompt for the user.  Since we don't have warnings and prompts before installing we disallow this.  Use an explicit fnmatch pattern if you want wildcarding)

default_release.description: Corresponds to the C(-t) option for I(apt) and sets pin priorities

only_upgrade.description: Only install/upgrade a package if it is already installed.

deb.description:
Path to a .deb package on the remote machine.
If :// in the path, ansible will attempt to download deb before installing. (Version added 2.1)

cache_valid_time.description: If C(update_cache) is specified and the last run is less or equal than I(cache_valid_time) seconds ago, the C(update_cache) gets skipped.

sqs_queue.description:
Create or delete AWS SQS queues.
Update attributes on existing queues.

message_retention_period.description: The message retention period in seconds.

name.description: Name of the queue.

default_visibility_timeout.description: The default visibility timeout in seconds.

state.description:
Default: present

Create or delete the queue

maximum_message_size.description: The maximum message size in bytes.

policy.description: The json dict policy to attach to queue

receive_message_wait_time.description: The receive message wait time in seconds.

rabbitmq_binding.description: This module uses rabbitMQ Rest API to create/delete bindings

name.description: source exchange to create binding on

src.description: source exchange to create binding on

dest.description: destination exchange or queue for the binding

login_user.description:
Default: guest

rabbitMQ user for connection

login_host.description:
Default: localhost

rabbitMQ host for connection

destination.description: destination exchange or queue for the binding

routing_key.description:
Default: #

routing key for the binding
default is

source.description: source exchange to create binding on

state.description:
Default: present

Whether the exchange should be present or absent
Only present implemented atm

arguments.description: extra arguments for exchange. If defined this argument is a key/value dictionary

login_password.description: rabbitMQ password for connection

vhost.description:
Default: /

rabbitMQ virtual host
default vhost is /

type.description: Either queue or exchange

dst.description: destination exchange or queue for the binding

s3_lifecycle.description: Manage s3 bucket lifecycle rules in AWS

status.description:
Default: enabled

If 'enabled', the rule is currently being applied. If 'disabled', the rule is not currently being applied.

transition_days.description: Indicates when, in days, an object transitions to a different storage class. If transition_date is not specified, this parameter is required.

name.description: Name of the s3 bucket

expiration_date.description: Indicates the lifetime of the objects that are subject to the rule by the date they will expire. The value must be ISO-8601 format, the time must be midnight and a GMT timezone must be specified.

state.description:
Default: present

Create or remove the lifecycle rule

prefix.description: Prefix identifying one or more objects to which the rule applies.  If no prefix is specified, the rule will apply to the whole bucket.

storage_class.description:
Default: glacier

The storage class to transition to. Currently there is only one valid value - 'glacier'.

expiration_days.description: Indicates the lifetime, in days, of the objects that are subject to the rule. The value must be a non-zero positive integer.

rule_id.description: Unique identifier for the rule. The value cannot be longer than 255 characters. A unique value for the rule will be generated if no value is provided.

transition_date.description: Indicates the lifetime of the objects that are subject to the rule by the date they will transition to a different storage class. The value must be ISO-8601 format, the time must be midnight and a GMT timezone must be specified. If transition_days is not specified, this parameter is required.

nxos_vlan.description: Manages VLAN configurations on NX-OS switches

vlan_state.description:
Default: active

Manage the vlan operational state of the VLAN (equivalent to state {active | suspend} command

name.description: name of VLAN

state.description:
Default: present

Manage the state of the resource

admin_state.description:
Default: up

Manage the vlan admin state of the VLAN equivalent to shut/no shut in vlan config mode

vlan_range.description: range of VLANs such as 2-10 or 2,5,10-15, etc.

os_port.description: Add, Update or Remove ports from an OpenStack cloud. A I(state) of 'present' will ensure the port is created or updated if required.

name.description:
Default: None

Name that has to be given to the port.

allowed_address_pairs.description:
Default: None

Allowed address pairs list.  Allowed address pairs are supported with dictionary structure. e.g.  allowed_address_pairs: - ip_address: 10.1.0.12 mac_address: ab:cd:ef:12:34:56 - ip_address: ...

extra_dhcp_opts.description:
Default: None

Extra dhcp options to be assigned to this port.  Extra options are supported with dictionary structure. e.g.  extra_dhcp_opts: - opt_name: opt name1 opt_value: value1 - opt_name: ...

state.description:
Default: present

Should the resource be present or absent.

device_owner.description:
Default: None

The ID of the entity that uses this port.

no_security_groups.description: Do not associate a security group with this port.

mac_address.description:
Default: None

MAC address of this port.

device_id.description:
Default: None

Device ID of device using this port.

fixed_ips.description:
Default: None

Desired IP and/or subnet for this port.  Subnet is referenced by subnet_id and IP is referenced by ip_address.

security_groups.description:
Default: None

Security group(s) ID(s) or name(s) associated with the port (comma separated string or YAML list)

network.description: Network ID or name this port belongs to.

seport.description: Manages SELinux network port type definitions.

ports.description: Ports or port ranges, separated by a comma

reload.description:
Default: True

Reload SELinux policy after commit.

setype.description: SELinux type for the specified port.

state.description:
Default: present

Desired boolean value.

interface.description: Full name of interface to be managed, i.e. Ethernet1/1

state.description:
Default: present

Manages desired state of the resource

vrf.description: Name of VRF to be managed

os_security_group.description: Add or Remove security groups from an OpenStack cloud.

state.description:
Default: present

Should the resource be present or absent.

name.description: Name that has to be given to the security group. This module requires that security group names be unique.

description.description:
Default: None

Long description of the purpose of the security group

iosxr_config.description: Cisco IOS XR configurations use a simple block indent file sytanx for segementing configuration into sections.  This module provides an implementation for working with IOS XR configuration sections in a deterministic way.  This module works with either CLI or NXAPI transports.

force.description: The force argument instructs the module to not consider the current devices running-config.  When set to true, this will cause the module to push the contents of I(src) into the device without first checking if already configured.

after.description: The ordered set of commands to append to the end of the command stack if a changed needs to be made.  Just like with I(before) this allows the playbook designer to append a set of commands to be executed after the command set.

lines.description: The ordered set of commands that should be configured in the section.  The commands must be the exact same commands as found in the device running-config.  Be sure to note the configuration command syntax as some commands are automatically modified by the device config parser.

replace.description:
Default: line

Instructs the module on the way to perform the configuration on the device.  If the replace argument is set to I(line) then the modified lines are pushed to the device in configuration mode.  If the replace argument is set to I(block) then the entire command block is pushed to the device in configuration mode if any line is not correct

parents.description: The ordered set of parents that uniquely identify the section the commands should be checked against.  If the parents argument is omitted, the commands are checked against the set of top level or global commands.

config.description: The module, by default, will connect to the remote device and retrieve the current running-config to use as a base for comparing against the contents of source.  There are times when it is not desirable to have the task get the current running-config for every task in a playbook.  The I(config) argument allows the implementer to pass in the configuruation to use as the base config for comparision.

match.description:
Default: line

Instructs the module on the way to perform the matching of the set of commands against the current device config.  If match is set to I(line), commands are matched line by line.  If match is set to I(strict), command lines are matched with respect to position.  Finally if match is set to I(exact), command lines must be an equal match.

before.description: The ordered set of commands to push on to the command stack if a change needs to be made.  This allows the playbook designer the opportunity to perform configuration commands prior to pushing any changes without affecting how the set of commands are matched against the system

sensu_check.description:
Manage the checks that should be run on a machine by I(Sensu).
Most options do not have a default and will not be added to the check definition unless specified.
All defaults except I(path), I(state), I(backup) and I(metric) are not managed by this module,
they are simply specified for your convenience.

metric.description: Whether the check is a metric

subdue_begin.description: When to disable handling of check failures

occurrences.description:
Default: 1

Number of event occurrences before the handler should take action

low_flap_threshold.description: The low threshhold for flap detection

publish.description:
Default: True

Whether the check should be scheduled at all.
You can still issue it via the sensu api

custom.description:
A hash/dictionary of custom parameters for mixing to the configuration.
You can't rewrite others module parameters using this

source.description: The check source, used to create a JIT Sensu client for an external resource (e.g. a network switch).

state.description:
Default: present

Whether the check should be present or not

subdue_end.description: When to enable handling of check failures

handle.description:
Default: True

Whether the check should be handled or not

dependencies.description:
Other checks this check depends on, if dependencies fail,
handling of this check will be disabled

subscribers.description:
List of subscribers/channels this check should run for
See sensu_subscribers to subscribe a machine to a channel

aggregate.description:
Classifies the check as an aggregate check,
making it available via the aggregate API

path.description:
Default: /etc/sensu/conf.d/checks.json

Path to the json file of the check to be added/removed.
Will be created if it does not exist (unless I(state=absent)).
The parent folders need to exist when I(state=present), otherwise an error will be thrown

name.description:
The name of the check
This is the key that is used to determine whether a check exists

standalone.description:
Whether the check should be scheduled by the sensu client or server
This option obviates the need for specifying the I(subscribers) option

handlers.description: List of handlers to notify when the check fails

refresh.description: Number of seconds handlers should wait before taking second action

command.description: Path to the sensu check to run (not required when I(state=absent))

high_flap_threshold.description: The low threshhold for flap detection

timeout.description:
Default: 10

Timeout for the check

backup.description:
Create a backup file (if yes), including the timestamp information so
you can get the original file back if you somehow clobbered it incorrectly.

typetalk.description: Send a message to typetalk using typetalk API ( http://developers.typetalk.in/ )

os_user_role.description: Grant and revoke roles in either project or domain context for OpenStack Identity Users.

domain.description: ID of the domain to scope the role association to. Valid only with keystone version 3, and required if I(project) is not specified.

group.description: Name or ID for the group. Valid only with keystone version 3. If I(group) is not specified, then I(user) is required. Both may not be specified.

project.description: Name or ID of the project to scope the role assocation to. If you are using keystone version 2, then this value is required.

state.description:
Default: present

Should the roles be present or absent on the user.

role.description: Name or ID for the role.

user.description: Name or ID for the user. If I(user) is not specified, then I(group) is required. Both may not be specified.

iam_cert.description: Allows for the management of server certificates

new_name.description: When present, this will update the name of the cert with the value passed here.

aws_secret_key.description: AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.

dup_ok.description: By default the module will not upload a certificate that is already uploaded into AWS. If set to True, it will upload the certificate as long as the name is unique.

new_path.description: When present, this will update the path of the cert with the value passed here.

name.description: Name of certificate to add, update or remove.

aws_access_key.description: AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.

cert.description: The path to the certificate body in PEM encoded format.

state.description: Whether to create, delete certificate. When present is specified it will attempt to make an update if new_path or new_name is specified.

key.description: The path to the private key of the certificate in PEM encoded format.

ec2_access_key.description: AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.

access_key.description: AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.

path.description:
Default: /

When creating or updating, specify the desired path of the certificate

secret_key.description: AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.

ec2_secret_key.description: AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.

cert_chain.description: The path to the CA certificate chain in PEM encoded format.

postgresql_db.description: Add or remove PostgreSQL databases from a remote host.

login_host.description:
Default: localhost

Host running the database

name.description: name of the database to add or remove

login_user.description: The username used to authenticate with

lc_collate.description: Collation order (LC_COLLATE) to use in the database. Must match collation order of template database unless C(template0) is used as template.

lc_ctype.description: Character classification (LC_CTYPE) to use in the database (e.g. lower, upper, ...) Must match LC_CTYPE of template database unless C(template0) is used as template.

login_unix_socket.description: Path to a Unix domain socket for local connections

state.description:
Default: present

The database state

template.description: Template used to create the database

login_password.description: The password used to authenticate with

owner.description: Name of the role to set as owner of the database

port.description:
Default: 5432

Database port to connect to.

rhn_register.description: Manage registration to the Red Hat Network.

username.description: Red Hat Network username

systemorgid.description:
Default: None

supply an organizational id for use with registration

server_url.description:
Default: Current value of I(serverURL) from C(/etc/sysconfig/rhn/up2date) is the default

Specify an alternative Red Hat Network server URL

channels.description: Optionally specify a list of comma-separated channels to subscribe to upon successful registration.

state.description:
Default: present

whether to register (C(present)), or unregister (C(absent)) a system

sslcacert.description:
Default: None

supply a custom ssl CA certificate file for use with registration

activationkey.description: supply an activation key for use with registration

profilename.description: supply an profilename for use with registration

password.description: Red Hat Network password

os_user.description: Manage OpenStack Identity users. Users can be created, updated or deleted using this module. A user will be updated if I(name) matches an existing user and I(state) is present. The value for I(name) cannot be updated without deleting and re-creating the user.

default_project.description:
Default: None

Project name or ID that the user should be associated with by default

name.description: Username for the user

enabled.description:
Default: True

Is the user enabled

domain.description:
Default: None

Domain to create the user in if the cloud supports domains

state.description:
Default: present

Should the resource be present or absent.

password.description:
Default: None

Password for the user
Required when I(state) is present

email.description:
Default: None

Email address for the user

win_get_url.description: Fetches a file from a URL and saves to locally

username.description: Basic authentication username

force.description:
Default: True

If C(yes), will always download the file.  If C(no), will only download the file if it does not exist or the remote file has been modified more recently than the local file.

url.description: The full URL of a file to download

skip_certificate_validation.description: Skip SSL certificate validation if true

proxy_url.description: The full URL of the proxy server to download through.

dest.description: The absolute path of the location to save the file at the URL. Be sure to include a filename and extension as appropriate.

password.description: Basic authentication password

ec2_vpc_net_facts.description: Gather facts about ec2 VPCs in AWS

filters.description: A dict of filters to apply. Each dict item consists of a filter key and a filter value. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeVpcs.html) for possible filters.

ec2_key.description: maintains ec2 key pairs. This module has a dependency on python-boto >= 2.5

state.description:
Default: present

create or delete keypair

wait_timeout.description:
Default: 300

How long before wait gives up, in seconds

name.description: Name of the key pair.

wait.description: Wait for the specified action to complete before returning.

ipify_facts.description: If behind NAT and need to know the public IP of your internet gateway.

api_url.description:
Default: https://api.ipify.org

URL of the ipify.org API service.
C(?format=json) will be appended per default.

cs_network.description: Create, update, restart and delete networks.

domain.description: Domain the network is related to.

end_ipv6.description:
The ending IPv6 address of the network belongs to.
If not specified, value of C(start_ipv6) is used.
Only considered on create.

gateway.description:
The gateway of the network.
Required for shared networks and isolated networks when it belongs to VPC.
Only considered on create.

poll_async.description:
Default: True

Poll async jobs until job has finished.

zone.description:
Name of the zone in which the network should be deployed.
If not set, default zone is used.

start_ipv6.description:
The beginning IPv6 address of the network belongs to.
Only considered on create.

cidr_ipv6.description:
CIDR of IPv6 network, must be at least /64.
Only considered on create.

state.description:
Default: present

State of the network.

end_ip.description:
The ending IPv4 address of the network belongs to.
If not specified, value of C(start_ip) is used.
Only considered on create.

vlan.description: The ID or VID of the network.

clean_up.description:
Cleanup old network elements.
Only considered on C(state=restarted).

netmask.description:
The netmask of the network.
Required for shared networks and isolated networks when it belongs to VPC.
Only considered on create.

network_offering.description:
Name of the offering for the network.
Required if C(state=present).

vpc.description: The ID or VID of the network.

start_ip.description:
The beginning IPv4 address of the network belongs to.
Only considered on create.

gateway_ipv6.description:
The gateway of the IPv6 network.
Required for shared networks.
Only considered on create.

display_text.description:
Display text of the network.
If not specified, C(name) will be used as C(display_text).

isolated_pvlan.description: The isolated private vlan for this network.

account.description: Account the network is related to.

name.description: Name (case sensitive) of the network.

project.description: Name of the project the network to be deployed in.

acl_type.description:
Default: account

Access control type.
Only considered on create.

accelerate.description:
This modules launches an ephemeral I(accelerate) daemon on the remote node which Ansible can use to communicate with nodes at high speed.
The daemon listens on a configurable port for a configurable amount of time.
Fireball mode is AES encrypted

ipv6.description: The listener daemon on the remote host will bind to the ipv6 localhost socket if this parameter is set to true.

minutes.description:
Default: 30

The I(accelerate) listener daemon is started on nodes and will stay around for this number of minutes before turning itself off.

port.description:
Default: 5099

TCP port for the socket connection

timeout.description:
Default: 300

The number of seconds the socket will wait for data. If none is received when the timeout value is reached, the connection will be closed.

multi_key.description: When enabled, the daemon will open a local socket file which can be used by future daemon executions to upload a new key to the already running daemon, so that multiple users can connect using different keys. This access still requires an ssh connection as the uid for which the daemon is currently running.

executable.description: Override the path to the cpanm executable

name.description: The name of the Perl library to install. You may use the "full distribution path", e.g.  MIYAGAWA/Plack-0.99_05.tar.gz

system_lib.description:
Use this if you want to install modules to the system perl include path. You must be root or have "passwordless" sudo for this to work.
This uses the cpanm commandline option '--sudo', which has nothing to do with ansible privilege escalation.

use_sudo.description:
Use this if you want to install modules to the system perl include path. You must be root or have "passwordless" sudo for this to work.
This uses the cpanm commandline option '--sudo', which has nothing to do with ansible privilege escalation.

mirror_only.description: Use the mirror's index file instead of the CPAN Meta DB

from_path.description: The local directory from where to install

pkg.description: The name of the Perl library to install. You may use the "full distribution path", e.g.  MIYAGAWA/Plack-0.99_05.tar.gz

version.description: minimum version of perl module to consider acceptable

mirror.description: Specifies the base URL for the CPAN mirror to use

locallib.description: Specify the install base to install modules

os_router.description: Create or Delete routers from OpenStack. Although Neutron allows routers to share the same name, this module enforces name uniqueness to be more user friendly.

enable_snat.description:
Default: True

Enable Source NAT (SNAT) attribute.

network.description:
Default: None

Unique name or ID of the external gateway network.
required I(interfaces) or I(enable_snat) are provided.

admin_state_up.description:
Default: True

Desired admin state of the created or existing router.

interfaces.description:
Default: None

List of subnets to attach to the router internal interface.

name.description: Name to be give to the router

state.description:
Default: present

Indicate desired state of the resource

external_fixed_ips.description:
Default: None

The IP address parameters for the external gateway network. Each is a dictionary with the subnet name or ID (subnet) and the IP address to assign on the subnet (ip). If no IP is specified, one is automatically assigned from that subnet.

state.description:
Default: present

Whether the bridge should exist

fail_mode.description:
Default: None

Set bridge fail-mode. The default value (None) is a No-op.

external_ids.description:
Default: None

A dictionary of external-ids. Omitting this parameter is a No-op. To  clear all external-ids pass an empty value.

timeout.description:
Default: 5

How long to wait for ovs-vswitchd to respond

digital_ocean_domain.description: Create/delete a DNS record in DigitalOcean.

ip.description: The IP address to point a domain at.

state.description:
Default: present

Indicate desired state of the target.

id.description: Numeric, the droplet id you want to operate on.

name.description: String, this is the name of the droplet - must be formatted by hostname rules, or the name of a SSH key, or the name of a domain.

redis.description: Unified utility to interact with redis instances. 'slave' sets a redis instance in slave or master mode. 'flush' flushes all the instance or a specified db. 'config' (new in 1.6), ensures a configuration setting on an instance.

login_port.description:
Default: 6379

The port to connect to

name.description: A redis config key.

flush_mode.description:
Default: all

Type of flush (all the dbs in a redis instance or a specific one) [flush command]

db.description: The database to flush (used in db mode) [flush command]

login_host.description:
Default: localhost

The host running the database

login_password.description: The password used to authenticate with (usually not used)

master_host.description: The host of the master instance [slave command]

value.description: A redis config value.

master_port.description: The port of the master instance [slave command]

slave_mode.description:
Default: slave

the mode of the redis instance [slave command]

campfire.description:
Send a message to Campfire.
Messages with newlines will result in a "Paste" message being sent.

room.description: Room number to which the message should be sent.

notify.description: Send a notification sound before the message.

lvol.description: This module creates, removes or resizes logical volumes.

force.description:
Default: no

Shrink or remove operations of volumes requires this switch. Ensures that that filesystems get never corrupted/destroyed by mistake.

vg.description: The volume group this logical volume is part of.

lv.description: The name of the logical volume.

state.description:
Default: present

Control if the logical volume exists. If C(present) the C(size) option is required.

snapshot.description: The name of the snapshot volume

opts.description: Free-form options to be passed to the lvcreate command

size.description: The size of the logical volume, according to lvcreate(8) --size, by default in megabytes or optionally with one of [bBsSkKmMgGtTpPeE] units; or according to lvcreate(8) --extents as a percentage of [VG|PVS|FREE]; Float values must begin with a digit. Resizing using percentage values was not supported prior to 2.1.

os_server_facts.description: Retrieve facts about server instances from OpenStack.

detailed.description: when true, return additional detail about servers at the expense of additional API calls.

server.description:
Default: None

restrict results to servers with names matching this glob expression (e.g., C<web*>).

cl_interface.description: Configures a front panel, sub-interface, SVI, management or loopback port on a Cumulus Linux switch. For bridge ports use the cl_bridge module. For bond ports use the cl_bond module. When configuring bridge related features like the "vid" option, please follow the guidelines for configuring "vlan aware" bridging. For more details review the Layer2 Interface Guide at http://docs.cumulusnetworks.com

clagd_sys_mac.description: Clagd system mac address. Recommended to use the range starting with 44:38:39:ff. Needs to be the same between 2 Clag switches

name.description: name of the interface

clagd_enable.description: Enables the clagd daemon. This command should only be applied to the clag peerlink interface

mstpctl_portnetwork.description: Enables bridge assurance in vlan-aware mode

speed.description: set speed of the swp(front panel) or management(eth0) interface. speed is in MB

clagd_peer_ip.description: IP address of the directly connected peer switch interface

clagd_priority.description: Integer that changes the role the switch has in the clag domain. The lower priority switch will assume the primary role. The number can be between 0 and 65535

mtu.description: set MTU. Configure Jumbo Frame by setting MTU to 9000.

pvid.description: in vlan aware mode, defines vlan that is the untagged vlan

virtual_mac.description: define Ethernet mac associated with Cumulus VRR feature

ipv6.description: list of IPv6 addresses  to configure on the interface. use X:X:X::X/YYY syntax

vids.description: in vlan aware mode, lists vlans defined under the interface

addr_method.description: can be loopback for loopback interfaces or dhcp for dhcp interfaces.

mstpctl_bpduguard.description: Enables BPDU Guard on a port in vlan-aware mode

ipv4.description: list of IPv4 addresses to configure on the interface. use X.X.X.X/YY syntax.

virtual_ip.description: define IPv4 virtual IP used by the Cumulus VRR feature

vertica_user.description:
Adds or removes Vertica database user and, optionally, assigns roles.
A user will not be removed until all the dependencies have been dropped.
In such a situation, if the module tries to remove the user it will fail and only remove roles granted to the user.

name.description: Name of the user to add or remove.

roles.description: Comma separated list of roles to assign to the user.

login_user.description:
Default: dbadmin

The username used to authenticate with.

login_password.description: The password used to authenticate with.

cluster.description:
Default: localhost

Name of the Vertica cluster.

state.description:
Default: present

Whether to create C(present), drop C(absent) or lock C(locked) a user.

role.description: Comma separated list of roles to assign to the user.

ldap.description:
Set to true if users are authenticated via LDAP.
The user will be created with password expired and set to I($ldap$).

password.description:
The user's password encrypted by the MD5 algorithm.
The password must be generated with the format C("md5" + md5[password + username]), resulting in a total of 35 characters. An easy way to do this is by querying the Vertica database with select 'md5'||md5('<user_password><user_name>').

port.description:
Default: 5433

Vertica cluster port to connect to.

os_nova_flavor.description: Add or remove flavors from OpenStack.

flavorid.description:
Default: auto

ID for the flavor. This is optional as a unique UUID will be assigned if a value is not specified.

name.description: Flavor name.

state.description:
Default: present

Indicate desired state of the resource. When I(state) is 'present', then I(ram), I(vcpus), and I(disk) are all required. There are no default values for those parameters.

is_public.description:
Default: True

Make flavor accessible to the public.

disk.description: Size of local disk, in GB.

assemble.description: Assembles a configuration file from fragments. Often a particular program will take a single configuration file and does not support a C(conf.d) style structure where it is easy to build up the configuration from multiple sources. M(assemble) will take a directory of files that can be local or have already been transferred to the system, and concatenate them together to produce a destination file. Files are assembled in string sorting order. Puppet calls this idea I(fragments).

ignore_hidden.description: A boolean that controls if files that start with a '.' will be included or not.

src.description: An already existing directory full of source files.

remote_src.description:
Default: True

If False, it will search for src at originating/master machine, if True it will go to the remote/target machine for the src. Default is True.

dest.description: A file to create using the concatenation of all of the source files.

delimiter.description: A delimiter to separate the file contents.

regexp.description: Assemble files only if C(regex) matches the filename. If not set, all files are assembled. All "\" (backslash) must be escaped as "\\" to comply yaml syntax. Uses Python regular expressions; see U(http://docs.python.org/2/library/re.html).

validate.description: The validation command to run before copying into place.  The path to the file to validate is passed in via '%s' which must be present as in the sshd example below. The command is passed securely so shell features like expansion and pipes won't work.

backup.description:
Default: no

Create a backup file (if C(yes)), including the timestamp information so you can get the original file back if you somehow clobbered it incorrectly.

os_security_group_rule.description: Add or Remove rule from an existing security group

direction.description:
Default: ingress

The direction in which the security group rule is applied. Not all providers support egress.

remote_ip_prefix.description: Source IP address(es) in CIDR notation (exclusive with remote_group)

state.description:
Default: present

Should the resource be present or absent.

ethertype.description:
Default: IPv4

Must be IPv4 or IPv6, and addresses represented in CIDR must match the ingress or egress rules. Not all providers support IPv6.

security_group.description: Name or ID of the security group

remote_group.description: Name or ID of the Security group to link (exclusive with remote_ip_prefix)

port.description: Destination port.

log.description: Log new connections matched to this rule

state.description:
C(enabled) reloads firewall and enables firewall on boot.
C(disabled) unloads firewall and disables firewall on boot.
C(reloaded) reloads firewall.
C(reset) disables and resets firewall to installation defaults.

policy.description: Change the default policy for incoming or outgoing traffic.

direction.description: Select direction for a rule or default policy command.

insert.description: Insert the corresponding rule as rule number NUM

dest.description:
Default: any

Destination IP address.

src.description:
Default: any

Source IP address.

logging.description: Toggles logging. Logged packets use the LOG_KERN syslog facility.

name.description: Use profile located in C(/etc/ufw/applications.d)

route.description: Apply the rule to routed/forwarded packets.

haproxy.description: Enable, disable, and set weights for HAProxy backend servers using socket commands.

socket.description:
Default: /var/run/haproxy.sock

Path to the HAProxy socket file.

weight.description: The value passed in argument. If the value ends with the `%` sign, then the new weight will be relative to the initially configured weight. Relative weights are only permitted between 0 and 100% and absolute weights are permitted between 0 and 256.

wait_interval.description:
Default: 5

Number of seconds to wait between retries.

host.description: Name of the backend host to change.

backend.description:
Default: auto-detected

Name of the HAProxy backend pool.

wait_retries.description:
Default: 25

Number of times to check for status after changing the state.

state.description: Desired state of the provided backend host.

shutdown_sessions.description: When disabling a server, immediately terminate all the sessions attached to the specified server. This can be used to terminate long-running sessions after a server is put into maintenance mode.

wait.description: Wait until the server reports a status of 'UP' when `state=enabled`, or status of 'MAINT' when `state=disabled`.

cs_zone_facts.description: Gathering facts from the API of a zone.

name.description: Name of the zone.

cs_facts.description: This module fetches data from the metadata API in CloudStack. The module must be called from within the instance itself.

package.description: Installs, upgrade and removes packages using the underlying OS package manager.

state.description: Whether to install (C(present), C(latest)), or remove (C(absent)) a package.

use.description:
Default: auto

The required package manager module to use (yum, apt, etc). The default 'auto' will use existing facts or try to autodetect it.
You should only use this field if the automatic selection is not working for some reason.

name.description:
Package name, or package specifier with version, like C(name-1.0).
Be aware that packages are not always named the same and this module will not 'translate' them per distro.

get_url.description:
Downloads files from HTTP, HTTPS, or FTP to the remote server. The remote server I(must) have direct access to the remote resource.
By default, if an environment variable C(<protocol>_proxy) is set on the target host, requests will be sent through that proxy. This behaviour can be overridden by setting a variable for this task (see `setting the environment <http://docs.ansible.com/playbooks_environment.html>`_), or by using the use_proxy option.
HTTP redirects can redirect from HTTP to HTTPS so you should be sure that your proxy environment for both protocols is correct.

url_password.description: The password for use in HTTP basic authentication. If the C(url_username) parameter is not specified, the C(url_password) parameter will not be used.

force.description:
Default: no

If C(yes) and C(dest) is not a directory, will download the file every time and replace the file if the contents change. If C(no), the file will only be downloaded if the destination does not exist. Generally should be C(yes) only for small local files. Prior to 0.6, this module behaved as if C(yes) was the default.

use_proxy.description:
Default: yes

if C(no), it will not use a proxy, even if one is defined in an environment variable on the target hosts.

thirsty.description:
Default: no

If C(yes) and C(dest) is not a directory, will download the file every time and replace the file if the contents change. If C(no), the file will only be downloaded if the destination does not exist. Generally should be C(yes) only for small local files. Prior to 0.6, this module behaved as if C(yes) was the default.

validate_certs.description:
Default: yes

If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

url.description: HTTP, HTTPS, or FTP URL in the form (http|https|ftp)://[user[:pass]]@host.domain[:port]/path

checksum.description: If a checksum is passed to this parameter, the digest of the destination file will be calculated after it is downloaded to ensure its integrity and verify that the transfer completed successfully. Format: <algorithm>:<checksum>, e.g.: checksum="sha256:D98291AC[...]B6DC7B97" If you worry about portability, only the sha1 algorithm is available on all platforms and python versions.  The third party hashlib library can be installed for access to additional algorithms. Additionaly, if a checksum is passed to this parameter, and the file exist under the C(dest) location, the destination_checksum would be calculated, and if checksum equals destination_checksum, the file download would be skipped (unless C(force) is true).

force_basic_auth.description:
Default: no

httplib2, the library used by the uri module only sends authentication information when a webservice responds to an initial request with a 401 status. Since some basic auth services do not properly send a 401, logins will fail. This option forces the sending of the Basic authentication header upon initial request.

sha256sum.description: If a SHA-256 checksum is passed to this parameter, the digest of the destination file will be calculated after it is downloaded to ensure its integrity and verify that the transfer completed successfully. This option is deprecated. Use 'checksum'.

dest.description:
absolute path of where to download the file to.
If C(dest) is a directory, either the server provided filename or, if none provided, the base name of the URL on the remote server will be used. If a directory, C(force) has no effect. If C(dest) is a directory, the file will always be downloaded (regardless of the force option), but replaced only if the contents changed.

headers.description: Add custom HTTP headers to a request in the format "key:value,key:value"

timeout.description:
Default: 10

Timeout in seconds for URL request

others.description: all arguments accepted by the M(file) module also work here

url_username.description: The username for use in HTTP basic authentication. This parameter can be used without C(url_password) for sites that allow empty passwords.

backup.description:
Default: no

Create a backup file including the timestamp information so you can get the original file back if you somehow clobbered it incorrectly.

tmp_dest.description:
absolute path of where temporary file is downloaded to.
Defaults to TMPDIR, TEMP or TMP env variables or a platform specific value
https://docs.python.org/2/library/tempfile.html#tempfile.tempdir

acl.description: Sets and retrieves file ACL information.

entry.description: DEPRECATED. The acl to set or remove.  This must always be quoted in the form of '<etype>:<qualifier>:<perms>'.  The qualifier may be empty for some types, but the type and perms are always requried. '-' can be used as placeholder when you do not care about permissions. This is now superseded by entity, type and permissions fields.

name.description: The full path of the file or object.

default.description: if the target is a directory, setting this to yes will make it the default acl for entities created inside the directory. It causes an error if name is a file.

recursive.description: Recursively sets the specified ACL (added in Ansible 2.0). Incompatible with C(state=query).

entity.description: actual user or group that the ACL applies to when matching entity types user or group are selected.

state.description:
Default: query

defines whether the ACL should be present or not.  The C(query) state gets the current acl without changing it, for use in 'register' operations.

follow.description:
Default: True

whether to follow symlinks on the path if a symlink is encountered.

etype.description: the entity type of the ACL to apply, see setfacl documentation for more info.

path.description: The full path of the file or object.

permissions.description: Permissions to apply/remove can be any combination of r, w and  x (read, write and execute respectively)

gitlab_project.description:
When the project does not exists in Gitlab, it will be created.
When the project does exists and state=absent, the project will be deleted.
When changes are made to the project, the project will be updated.

verify_ssl.description:
Default: True

When using https if SSL certificate needs to be verified.

group.description:
The name of the group of which this projects belongs to.
When not provided, project will belong to user which is configured in 'login_user' or 'login_token'
When provided with username, project will be created for this user. 'login_user' or 'login_token' needs admin rights.

merge_requests_enabled.description:
Default: True

If merge requests can be made or not.
Possible values are true and false.

import_url.description:
Git repository which will me imported into gitlab.
Gitlab server needs read access to this git repository.

login_user.description: Gitlab user name.

server_url.description: Url of Gitlab server, with protocol (http or https).

name.description: The name of the project

path.description:
The path of the project you want to create, this will be server_url/<group>/path
If not supplied, name will be used.

state.description:
Default: present

create or delete project.
Possible values are present and absent.

issues_enabled.description:
Default: True

Whether you want to create issues or not.
Possible values are true and false.

login_password.description: Gitlab password for login_user

snippets_enabled.description:
Default: True

If creating snippets should be available or not.
Possible values are true and false.

wiki_enabled.description:
Default: True

If an wiki for this project should be available or not.
Possible values are true and false.

visibility_level.description:
Private. visibility_level is 0. Project access must be granted explicitly for each user.
Internal. visibility_level is 10. The project can be cloned by any logged in user.
Public. visibility_level is 20. The project can be cloned without any authentication.
Possible values are 0, 10 and 20.

validate_certs.description:
Default: True

When using https if SSL certificate needs to be verified.

public.description:
If the project is public available or not.
Setting this to true is same as setting visibility_level to 20.
Possible values are true and false.

description.description: An description for the project.

selinux_permissive.description: Add and remove domain from the list of permissive domain.

store.description: name of the SELinux policy store to use

no_reload.description:
automatically reload the policy after a change
default is set to 'false' as that's what most people would want after changing one domain
Note that this doesn't work on older version of the library (example EL 6), the module will silently ignore it in this case

permissive.description: indicate if the domain should or should not be set as permissive

azure.description: Creates or terminates azure instances. When created optionally waits for it to be 'running'.

azure role size for the new virtual machine (e.g., Small, ExtraLarge, A6). You have to pay attention to the fact that instances of type G and DS are not available in all regions (locations). Make sure if you selected the size and type of instance available in your chosen location.

location.description: the azure location to use (e.g. 'East US')

wait_timeout_redirects.description:

how long before wait gives up for redirects, in seconds

management_cert_path.description: path to an azure management certificate associated with the subscription id. Overrides the AZURE_CERT_PATH environment variable.

ssh_cert_path.description:
path to an X509 certificate containing the public ssh key to install in the virtual machine. See http://www.windowsazure.com/en-us/manage/linux/tutorials/intro-to-linux/ for more details.
if this option is specified, password-based ssh authentication will be disabled.

Default: 600

how long before wait gives up, in seconds

auto_updates.description:

The type of the os that is gettings provisioned

subscription_id.description: azure subscription id. Overrides the AZURE_SUBSCRIPTION_ID environment variable.

postgresql_lang.description:
Adds, removes or changes procedural languages with a PostgreSQL database.
This module allows you to add a language, remote a language or change the trust relationship with a PostgreSQL database. The module can be used on the machine where executed or on a remote host.
When removing a language from a database, it is possible that dependencies prevent the database from being removed. In that case, you can specify casade to automatically drop objects that depend on the language (such as functions in the language). In case the language can't be deleted because it is required by the database system, you can specify fail_on_drop=no to ignore the error.
Be carefull when marking a language as trusted since this could be a potential security breach. Untrusted languages allow only users with the PostgreSQL superuser privilege to use this language to create new functions.

lang.description: name of the procedural language to add, remove or change

cascade.description:
when dropping a language, also delete object that depend on this language.
only used when C(state=absent).

login_user.description:
Default: postgres

User used to authenticate with PostgreSQL

login_host.description:
Default: localhost

Host running PostgreSQL where you want to execute the actions.

db.description: name of database where the language will be added, removed or changed

force_trust.description:
marks the language as trusted, even if it's marked as untrusted in pg_pltemplate.
use with care!

state.description:
Default: present

The state of the language for the selected database

login_password.description: Password used to authenticate with PostgreSQL (must match C(login_user))

trust.description: make this language trusted for the selected db

fail_on_drop.description:
Default: yes

if C(yes), fail when removing a language. Otherwise just log and continue
in some cases, it is not possible to remove a language (used by the db-system). When         dependencies block the removal, consider using C(cascade).

port.description:
Default: 5432

Database port to connect to.

consul_acl.description: allows the addition, modification and deletion of ACL keys and associated rules in a consul cluster via the agent. For more details on using and configuring ACLs, see https://www.consul.io/docs/internals/acl.html.

rules.description: an list of the rules that should be associated with a given token.

validate_certs.description:
Default: True

whether to verify the tls certificate of the consul agent

token.description: the token key indentifying an ACL rule set. If generated by consul this will be a UUID.

state.description: whether the ACL pair should be present or absent, defaults to present

mgmt_token.description: a management token is required to manipulate the acl lists

host.description:
Default: localhost

host of the consul agent defaults to localhost

scheme.description:
Default: http

the protocol scheme on which the consul agent is running

type.description: the type of token that should be created, either management or client, defaults to client

port.description:
Default: 8500

the port on which the consul agent is running

git.description: Manage I(git) checkouts of repositories to deploy files or software.

executable.description: Path to git executable to use. If not supplied, the normal mechanism for resolving binary paths will be used.

refspec.description: Add an additional refspec to be fetched. If version is set to a I(SHA-1) not reachable from any branch or tag, this option may be necessary to specify the ref containing the I(SHA-1). Uses the same syntax as the 'git fetch' command. An example value could be "refs/meta/config".

force.description:
Default: no

If C(yes), any modified files in the working repository will be discarded.  Prior to 0.7, this was always 'yes' and could not be disabled.  Prior to 1.9, the default was `yes`

track_submodules.description:
Default: no

if C(yes), submodules will track the latest commit on their master branch (or other branch specified in .gitmodules).  If C(no), submodules will be kept at the revision specified by the main project. This is equivalent to specifying the --remote flag to git submodule update.

dest.description: Absolute path of where the repository should be checked out to. This parameter is required, unless C(clone) is set to C(no) This change was made in version 1.8.3. Prior to this version, the C(dest) parameter was always required.

recursive.description:
Default: yes

if C(no), repository will be cloned without the --recursive option, skipping sub-modules.

clone.description:
Default: yes

If C(no), do not clone the repository if it does not exist locally

verify_commit.description:
Default: no

if C(yes), when cloning or checking out a C(version) verify the signature of a GPG signed commit. This requires C(git) version>=2.1.0 to be installed. The commit MUST be signed and the public key MUST be trusted in the GPG trustdb.

update.description:
Default: yes

If C(no), do not retrieve new revisions from the origin repository

accept_hostkey.description:
Default: no

if C(yes), adds the hostkey for the repo url if not already added. If ssh_opts contains "-o StrictHostKeyChecking=no", this parameter is ignored.

ssh_opts.description:
Default: None

Creates a wrapper script and exports the path as GIT_SSH which git then automatically uses to override ssh arguments. An example value could be "-o StrictHostKeyChecking=no"

repo.description: git, SSH, or HTTP(S) protocol address of the git repository.

depth.description: Create a shallow clone with a history truncated to the specified number or revisions. The minimum possible value is C(1), otherwise ignored. Needs I(git>=1.9.1) to work correctly.

version.description:
Default: HEAD

What version of the repository to check out.  This can be the full 40-character I(SHA-1) hash, the literal string C(HEAD), a branch name, or a tag name.

bare.description:
Default: no

if C(yes), repository will be created as a bare repo, otherwise it will be a standard repo with a workspace.

remote.description:
Default: origin

Name of the remote.

key_file.description:
Default: None

Specify an optional private key file to use for the checkout.

name.description: git, SSH, or HTTP(S) protocol address of the git repository.
