split.description:
Default: None

character used to split the database values into lists/arrays such as ':' or '	', otherwise  it will try to pick one depending on the database

key.description: key from which to return values from the specified database, otherwise the full contents are returned.

database.description: the name of a getent database supported by the target system (passwd, group, hosts, etc).

vca_vapp.description: This module will actively managed vCloud Air vApp instances.  Instances can be created and deleted as well as both deployed and undeployed.

vm_name.description:
Default: None

The name of the virtual machine instance in the vApp to manage.

username.description:
Default: None

The vCloud Air username to use during authentication

vm_memory.description:
Default: None

The amount of memory in MB to allocate to VMs in the vApp.  If the I(vm_name) argument is provided, then this becomes a per VM setting otherise it is applied to all VMs in the vApp.

state.description:
Default: present

Configures the state of the vApp.

template_name.description:
Default: None

The name of the vApp template to use to create the vApp instance.  If the I(state) is not `absent` then the I(template_name) value must be provided.  The I(template_name) must be previously uploaded to the catalog specified by I(catalog_name)

instance_id.description:
Default: None

The instance id in a vchs environment to be used for creating the vapp

host.description:
Default: None

The authentication host to be used when service type  is vcd.

network_mode.description:
Default: pool

Configures the mode of the network connection.

vapp_name.description: The name of the vCloud Air vApp instance

network_name.description:
Default: None

The name of the network that should be attached to the virtual machine in the vApp.  The virtual network specified must already be created in the vCloud Air VDC.  If the I(state) is not 'absent' then the I(network_name) argument must be provided.

service_type.description:
Default: vca

The type of service we are authenticating against

org.description:
Default: None

The org to login to for creating vapp, mostly set when the service_type is vdc.

operation.description:
Default: noop

Specifies an operation to be performed on the vApp.

password.description:
Default: None

The vCloud Air password to use during authentication

vm_cpus.description:
Default: None

The number of vCPUs to configure for the VM in the vApp.   If the I(vm_name) argument is provided, then this becomes a per VM setting otherwise it is applied to all VMs in the vApp.

vdc_name.description:
Default: None

The name of the virtual data center (VDC) where the vm should be created or contains the vAPP.

api_version.description:
Default: 5.7

The api version to be used with the vca

vertica_role.description: Adds or removes Vertica database role and, optionally, assign other roles.

assigned_roles.description: Comma separated list of roles to assign to the role.

name.description: Name of the role to add or remove.

login_user.description:
Default: dbadmin

The username used to authenticate with.

cluster.description:
Default: localhost

Name of the Vertica cluster.

state.description:
Default: present

Whether to create C(present), drop C(absent) or lock C(locked) a role.

login_password.description: The password used to authenticate with.

port.description:
Default: 5433

Vertica cluster port to connect to.

assigned_role.description: Comma separated list of roles to assign to the role.

htpasswd.description:
Add and remove username/password entries in a password file using htpasswd.
This is used by web servers such as Apache and Nginx for basic authentication.

username.description: User name to add or remove

name.description: User name to add or remove

dest.description: Path to the file that contains the usernames and passwords

create.description:
Default: yes

Used with C(state=present). If specified, the file will be created if it does not already exist. If set to "no", will fail if the file does not exist

destfile.description: Path to the file that contains the usernames and passwords

state.description:
Default: present

Whether the user entry should be present or not

path.description: Path to the file that contains the usernames and passwords

password.description:
Password associated with user.
Must be specified if user does not exist yet.

crypt_scheme.description:
Default: apr_md5_crypt

Encryption scheme to be used.  As well as the four choices listed here, you can also use any other hash supported by passlib, such as md5_crypt and sha256_crypt, which are linux passwd hashes.  If you do so the password file will not be compatible with Apache or Nginx

hg.description: Manages Mercurial (hg) repositories. Supports SSH, HTTP/S and local address.

executable.description: Path to hg executable to use. If not supplied, the normal mechanism for resolving binary paths will be used.

force.description:
Default: no

Discards uncommitted changes. Runs C(hg update -C).  Prior to 1.9, the default was `yes`.

name.description: The repository address.

dest.description: Absolute path of where the repository should be cloned to.

update.description:
Default: yes

If C(no), do not retrieve new revisions from the origin repository

purge.description:
Default: no

Deletes untracked files. Runs C(hg purge).

version.description: Equivalent C(-r) option in hg command which could be the changeset, revision number, branch name or even tag.

revision.description: Equivalent C(-r) option in hg command which could be the changeset, revision number, branch name or even tag.

win_uri.description: Interacts with HTTP and HTTPS web services and supports Digest, Basic and WSSE HTTP authentication mechanisms.

body.description: The body of the HTTP request/response to the web service.

url.description: HTTP or HTTPS URL in the form of (http|https)://host.domain:port/path

use_basic_parsing.description:
Default: True

This module relies upon 'Invoke-WebRequest', which by default uses the Internet Explorer Engine to parse a webpage. There's an edge-case where if a user hasn't run IE before, this will fail. The only advantage to using the Internet Explorer praser is that you can traverse the DOM in a powershell script. That isn't useful for Ansible, so by default we toggle 'UseBasicParsing'. However, you can toggle that off here.

headers.description: Key Value pairs for headers. Example "Host: www.somesite.com"

method.description:
Default: GET

The HTTP Method of the request or response.

product_id.description: product id of the installed package (used for checking if already installed)

user_password.description: Password of an account with access to the package if its located on a file share. Only needed if the winrm user doesn't have access to the package. Also specify user_name for this to function properly.

state.description:
Default: present

Install or Uninstall

path.description: Location of the package to be installed (either on file system, network share or url)

productid.description: product id of the installed package (used for checking if already installed)

user_name.description: Username of an account with access to the package if its located on a file share. Only needed if the winrm user doesn't have access to the package. Also specify user_password for this to function properly.

name.description: name of the package. Just for logging reasons, will use the value of path if name isn't specified

zabbix_screen.description: This module allows you to create, modify and delete Zabbix screens and associated graph data.

url.description: Url of Zabbix server, with protocol (http or https).

login_user.description: Zabbix user name.

server_url.description: Url of Zabbix server, with protocol (http or https).

screens.description:
List of screens to be created/updated/deleted(see example).
If the screen(s) already been added, the screen(s) name won't be updated.
When creating or updating screen(s), C(screen_name), C(host_group) are required.
When deleting screen(s), the C(screen_name) is required.
The available states are: C(present) (default) and C(absent). If the screen(s) already exists, and the state is not C(absent), the screen(s) will just be updated as needed.

timeout.description:
Default: 10

The timeout of API request (seconds).

login_password.description: Zabbix user password.

pacman.description: Manage packages with the I(pacman) package manager, which is used by Arch Linux and its variants.

upgrade.description: Whether or not to upgrade whole system

force.description: When removing package - force remove package, without any checks. When update_cache - force redownload repo databases.

name.description: Name of the package to install, upgrade, or remove.

recurse.description: When removing a package, also remove its dependencies, provided that they are not required by other packages and were not explicitly installed by a user.

state.description:
Default: present

Desired state of the package.

update_cache.description: Whether or not to refresh the master package lists. This can be run as part of a package installation or as a separate step.

state.description:
Default: enabled

Specify if plugins are to be enabled or disabled

prefix.description: Specify a custom install prefix to a Rabbit

name.description: Comma-separated list of plugin names

new_only.description:
Default: no

Only enable missing plugins
Does not disable plugins that are not in the names list

firewalld.description: This module allows for addition or deletion of services and ports either tcp or udp in either running or permanent firewalld rules.

zone.description:
Default: system-default(public)

The firewalld zone to add/remove to/from (NOTE: default zone can be configured per system but "public" is default from upstream. Available choices can be extended based on per-system configs, listed here are "out of the box" defaults).

service.description: Name of a service to add/remove to/from firewalld - service must be listed in /etc/services.

masquerade.description: The masquerade setting you would like to enable/disable to/from zones within firewalld

immediate.description: Should this configuration be applied immediately, if set as permanent

source.description: The source/network you would like to add/remove to/from firewalld

state.description: Should this port accept(enabled) or reject(disabled) connections.

permanent.description: Should this configuration be in the running firewalld configuration or persist across reboots.

timeout.description: The amount of time the rule should be in effect for when non-permanent.

interface.description: The interface you would like to add/remove to/from a zone in firewalld

port.description: Name of a port or port range to add/remove to/from firewalld. Must be in the form PORT/PROTOCOL or PORT-PORT/PROTOCOL for port ranges.

rich_rule.description: Rich rule to add/remove to/from firewalld.

grove.description: The M(grove) module sends a message for a service to a Grove.io channel.

service.description:
Default: ansible

Name of the service (displayed as the "user" in the message)

url.description: Service URL for the web client

channel_token.description: Token of the channel to post to.

validate_certs.description:
Default: yes

If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

lvg.description: This module creates, removes or resizes volume groups.

vg_options.description: Additional options to pass to C(vgcreate) when creating the volume group.

pvs.description:
List of comma-separated devices to use as physical devices in this volume group. Required when creating or resizing volume group.
The module will take care of running pvcreate if needed.

force.description:
Default: no

If yes, allows to remove volume group with logical volumes.

vg.description: The name of the volume group.

state.description:
Default: present

Control if the volume group exists.

pesize.description:
Default: 4

The size of the physical extent in megabytes. Must be a power of 2.

azure_rm_securitygroup.description: Create, update or delete a network security group. A security group contains Access Control List (ACL) rules that allow or deny network traffic to subnets or individual network interfaces. A security group is created with a set of default security rules and an empty set of security rules. Shape traffic flow by adding rules to the empty set of security rules.

resource_group.description: Name of the resource group the security group belongs to.

purge_rules.description: Remove any existing rules not matching those defined in the rules parameters.

rules.description: Set of rules shaping traffic flow to or from a subnet or NIC. Each rule is a dictionary.

default_rules.description: The set of default rules automatically added to a security group at creation. In general default rules will not be modified. Modify rules to shape the flow of traffic to or from a subnet or NIC. See rules below for the makeup of a rule dict.

purge_default_rules.description: Remove any existing rules not matching those defined in the default_rules parameter.

state.description:
Default: present

Assert the state of the security group. Set to 'present' to create or update a security group. Set to 'absent' to remove a security group.

location.description:
Default: resource_group location

Valid azure location. Defaults to location of the resource group.

name.description: Name of the security group to operate on.

custom_id.description:
Custom id to the resource.
Allowed to Root Admins only.

account.description: Account the volume is related to.

force.description:
Force removal of volume even it is attached to a VM.
Considered on C(state=absnet) only.

disk_offering.description:
Name of the disk offering to be used.
Required one of C(disk_offering), C(snapshot) if volume is not already C(state=present).

name.description:
Name of the volume.
C(name) can only contain ASCII letters.

state.description:
Default: present

State of the volume.

domain.description: Name of the domain the volume to be deployed in.

shrink_ok.description: Whether to allow to shrink the volume.

project.description: Name of the project the volume to be deployed in.

display_volume.description:
Default: True

Whether to display the volume to the end user or not.
Allowed to Root Admins only.

snapshot.description:
The snapshot name for the disk volume.
Required one of C(disk_offering), C(snapshot) if volume is not already C(state=present).

vm.description: Name of the virtual machine to attach the volume to.

poll_async.description:
Default: True

Poll async jobs until job has finished.

zone.description:
Name of the zone in which the volume should be deployed.
If not set, default zone is used.

mongodb_user.description: Adds or removes a user from a MongoDB database.

login_port.description:
Default: 27017

The port to connect to

update_password.description:
Default: always

C(always) will update passwords if they differ.  C(on_create) will only set the password for newly created users.

name.description: The name of the user to add or remove

roles.description:
Default: readWrite

The database user roles valid values could either be one or more of the following strings: 'read', 'readWrite', 'dbAdmin', 'userAdmin', 'clusterAdmin', 'readAnyDatabase', 'readWriteAnyDatabase', 'userAdminAnyDatabase', 'dbAdminAnyDatabase'
Or the following dictionary '{ db: DATABASE_NAME, role: ROLE_NAME }'.
This param requires pymongo 2.5+. If it is a string, mongodb 2.4+ is also required. If it is a dictionary, mongo 2.6+  is required.

database.description: The name of the database to add/remove the user from

login_user.description: The username used to authenticate with

login_host.description:
Default: localhost

The host running the database

login_password.description: The password used to authenticate with

ssl.description: Whether to use an SSL connection when connecting to the database

state.description:
Default: present

The database user state

user.description: The name of the user to add or remove

login_database.description: The database where login credentials are stored

password.description: The password to use for the user

replica_set.description: Replica set to connect to (automatically connects to primary for writes)

vmware_target_canonical_facts.description: Return canonical (NAA) from an ESXi host based on SCSI target ID

target_id.description: The target id based on order of scsi device

expect.description:
The M(expect) module executes a command and responds to prompts
The given command will be executed on all selected nodes. It will not be processed through the shell, so variables like C($HOME) and operations like C("<"), C(">"), C("|"), and C("&") will not work

chdir.description: cd into this directory before running the command

responses.description: Mapping of expected string/regex and string to respond with. If the response is a list, successive matches return successive responses. List functionality is new in 2.1.

removes.description: a filename, when it does not exist, this step will B(not) be run.

echo.description: Whether or not to echo out your response strings

creates.description: a filename, when it already exists, this step will B(not) be run.

command.description: the command module takes command to run.

timeout.description:
Default: 30

Amount of time in seconds to wait for the expected strings

set.description:
Default: None

Set a single property on a port.

state.description:
Default: present

Whether the port should exist

timeout.description:
Default: 5

How long to wait for ovs-vswitchd to respond

external_ids.description: Dictionary of external_ids applied to a port.

port.description: Name of port to manage on the bridge

cs_project.description: Create, update, suspend, activate and remove projects.

display_text.description:
Display text of the project.
If not specified, C(name) will be used as C(display_text).

account.description: Account the project is related to.

poll_async.description:
Default: True

Poll async jobs until job has finished.

name.description: Name of the project.

domain.description: Domain the project is related to.

state.description:
Default: present

State of the project.

value.description: If set, then sets variable value to this

svc.description: Controls daemontools services on remote hosts using the svc utility.

name.description: Name of the service to manage.

downed.description: Should a 'down' file exist or not, if it exists it disables auto startup. defaults to no. Downed does not imply stopped.

enabled.description: Wheater the service is enabled or not, if disabled it also implies stopped. Make note that a service can be enabled and downed (no auto restart).

state.description: C(Started)/C(stopped) are idempotent actions that will not run commands unless necessary.  C(restarted) will always bounce the svc (svc -t) and C(killed) will always bounce the svc (svc -k). C(reloaded) will send a sigusr1 (svc -1). C(once) will run a normally downed svc once (svc -o), not really an idempotent operation.

service_dir.description:
Default: /service

directory svscan watches for services

service_src.description: directory where services are defined, the source of symlinks to service_dir.

name.description: Name of the pod.

zone.description:
Name of the zone in which the pod belongs to.
If not set, default zone is used.

state.description:
Default: present

State of the pod.

netmask.description:
Netmask for the Pod.
Required on C(state=present)

end_ip.description: Ending IP address for the Pod.

start_ip.description:
Starting IP address for the Pod.
Required on C(state=present)

gateway.description:
Gateway for the Pod.
Required on C(state=present)

circonus_annotation.description: Create an annotation event with a given category, title and description. Optionally start, end or durations can be provided

description.description: Description of annotation

stop.description: Unix timestamp of event end, defaults to now + duration

start.description: Unix timestamp of event start, defaults to now

duration.description: Duration in seconds of annotation, defaults to 0

clc_publicip.description: An Ansible module to add or delete public ip addresses on an existing server or servers in CenturyLink Cloud.

server_ids.description: A list of servers to create public ips on.

state.description:
Default: present

Determine whether to create or delete public IPs. If present module will not create a second public ip if one already exists.

protocol.description:
Default: TCP

The protocol that the public IP will listen for.

ports.description:
Default: None

A list of ports to expose. This is required when state is 'present'

wait.description:
Default: True

Whether to wait for the tasks to finish before returning.

flowdock.description: Send a message to a flowdock team inbox or chat using the push API (see https://www.flowdock.com/api/team-inbox and https://www.flowdock.com/api/chat)

from_name.description: (inbox only) Name of the message sender

from_address.description: (inbox only - required) Email address of the message sender

tags.description: tags of the message, separated by commas

validate_certs.description:
Default: yes

If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

external_user_name.description: (chat only - required) Name of the "user" sending the message

project.description: (inbox only) Human readable identifier for more detailed message categorization

source.description: (inbox only - required) Human readable identifier of the application that uses the Flowdock API

link.description: (inbox only) Link associated with the message. This will be used to link the message subject in Team Inbox.

type.description: Whether to post to 'inbox' or 'chat'

subject.description: (inbox only - required) Subject line of the message

file.description: Sets attributes of files, symlinks, and directories, or removes files/symlinks/directories. Many other modules support the same options as the M(file) module - including M(copy), M(template), and M(assemble).

src.description: path of the file to link to (applies only to C(state=link)). Will accept absolute, relative and nonexisting paths. Relative paths are not expanded.

force.description:
Default: no

force the creation of the symlinks in two cases: the source file does not exist (but will appear later); the destination exists and is a file (so, we need to unlink the "path" file and create symlink to the "src" file in place of it).

name.description: path to the file being managed.  Aliases: I(dest), I(name)

dest.description: path to the file being managed.  Aliases: I(dest), I(name)

recurse.description:
Default: no

recursively set the specified file attributes (applies only to state=directory)

state.description:
Default: file

If C(directory), all immediate subdirectories will be created if they do not exist, since 1.7 they will be created with the supplied permissions. If C(file), the file will NOT be created if it does not exist, see the M(copy) or M(template) module if you want that behavior.  If C(link), the symbolic link will be created or changed. Use C(hard) for hardlinks. If C(absent), directories will be recursively deleted, and files or symlinks will be unlinked. If C(touch) (new in 1.4), an empty file will be created if the C(path) does not exist, while an existing file or directory will receive updated file access and modification times (similar to the way `touch` works from the command line).

follow.description:
Default: no

This flag indicates that filesystem links, if they exist, should be followed.

path.description: path to the file being managed.  Aliases: I(dest), I(name)

clc_aa_policy.description: An Ansible module to Create or Delete Anti Affinity Policies at CenturyLink Cloud.

state.description:
Default: present

Whether to create or delete the policy.

wait.description:
Default: True

Whether to wait for the tasks to finish before returning.

location.description: Datacenter in which the policy lives/should live.

name.description: The name of the Anti Affinity Policy.

pip.description: Manage Python library dependencies. To use this module, one of the following keys is required: C(name) or C(requirements).

virtualenv.description: An optional path to a I(virtualenv) directory to install into. It cannot be specified together with the 'executable' parameter (added in 2.1).

virtualenv_command.description:
Default: virtualenv

The command or a pathname to the command to create the virtual environment with. For example C(pyvenv), C(virtualenv), C(virtualenv2), C(~/bin/virtualenv), C(/usr/local/bin/virtualenv).

chdir.description: cd into this directory before running the command

requirements.description: The path to a pip requirements file, which should be local to the remote system. File can be specified as a relative path if using the chdir option.

name.description: The name of a Python library to install or the url of the remote package.

virtualenv_python.description: The Python executable used for creating the virtual environment. For example C(python3.4), C(python2.7). When not specified, the system Python version is used.

umask.description: The system umask to apply before installing the pip package. This is useful, for example, when installing on systems that have a very restrictive umask by default (e.g., 0077) and you want to pip install packages which are to be used by all users. Note that this requires you to specify desired umask mode in octal, with a leading 0 (e.g., 0077).

editable.description:
Default: True

Pass the editable flag for versioning URLs.

executable.description: The explicit executable or a pathname to the executable to be used to run pip for a specific version of Python installed in the system. For example C(pip-3.3), if there are both Python 2.7 and 3.3 installations in the system and you want to run pip for the Python 3.3 installation. It cannot be specified together with the 'virtualenv' parameter (added in 2.1).

virtualenv_site_packages.description:
Default: no

Whether the virtual environment will inherit packages from the global site-packages directory.  Note that if this setting is changed on an already existing virtual environment it will not have any effect, the environment must be deleted and newly created.

state.description:
Default: present

The state of module
The 'forcereinstall' option is only available in Ansible 2.1 and above.

version.description: The version number to install of the Python library specified in the I(name) parameter

ios_config.description: Cisco IOS configurations use a simple block indent file sytanx for segementing configuration into sections.  This module provides an implementation for working with IOS configuration sections in a deterministic way.

force.description: The force argument instructs the module to not consider the current devices running-config.  When set to true, this will cause the module to push the contents of I(src) into the device without first checking if already configured.

after.description: The ordered set of commands to append to the end of the command stack if a changed needs to be made.  Just like with I(before) this allows the playbook designer to append a set of commands to be executed after the command set.

lines.description: The ordered set of commands that should be configured in the section.  The commands must be the exact same commands as found in the device running-config.  Be sure to note the configuration command syntax as some commands are automatically modified by the device config parser.

replace.description:
Default: line

Instructs the module on the way to perform the configuration on the device.  If the replace argument is set to I(line) then the modified lines are pushed to the device in configuration mode.  If the replace argument is set to I(block) then the entire command block is pushed to the device in configuration mode if any line is not correct

parents.description: The ordered set of parents that uniquely identify the section the commands should be checked against.  If the parents argument is omitted, the commands are checked against the set of top level or global commands.

config.description: The module, by default, will connect to the remote device and retrieve the current running-config to use as a base for comparing against the contents of source.  There are times when it is not desirable to have the task get the current running-config for every task in a playbook.  The I(config) argument allows the implementer to pass in the configuruation to use as the base config for comparision.

match.description:
Default: line

Instructs the module on the way to perform the matching of the set of commands against the current device config.  If match is set to I(line), commands are matched line by line.  If match is set to I(strict), command lines are matched with respect to position.  Finally if match is set to I(exact), command lines must be an equal match.

before.description: The ordered set of commands to push on to the command stack if a change needs to be made.  This allows the playbook designer the opportunity to perform configuration commands prior to pushing any changes without affecting how the set of commands are matched against the system

win_stat.description: Returns information about a Windows file

path.description: The full path of the file/object to get the facts of; both forward and back slashes are accepted.

get_md5.description:
Default: True

Whether to return the checksum sum of the file. As of Ansible 1.9 this is no longer a MD5, but a SHA1 instead.

get_checksum.description:
Default: True

Whether to return a checksum of the file (only sha1 currently supported)

azure_rm_networkinterface_facts.description: Get facts for a specific network interface or all network interfaces within a resource group.

name.description: Only show results for a specific network interface.

resource_group.description: Name of the resource group containing the network interface(s). Required when searching by name.

tags.description: Limit results by providing a list of tags. Format tags as 'key' or 'key:value'.

cl_ports.description: Set the initial port attribute defined in the Cumulus Linux ports.conf, file. This module does not do any error checking at the moment. Be careful to not include ports that do not exist on the switch. Carefully read the original ports.conf file for any exceptions or limitations. For more details go the Configure Switch Port Attribute Documentation at http://docs.cumulusnetworks.com

speed_4_by_10g.description: list of 40G ports that will be unganged to run as 4 10G ports.

speed_10g.description: list of ports to run initial run at 10G

speed_40g.description: list of ports to run initial run at 40G

speed_40g_div_4.description: list of 10G ports that will be ganged to form a 40G port

ec2_vpc_subnet.description: Manage subnets in AWS virtual private clouds

tags.description: A dict of tags to apply to the subnet. Any tags currently applied to the subnet and not present here will be removed.

state.description:
Default: present

Create or remove the subnet

vpc_id.description: VPC ID of the VPC in which to create the subnet.

resource_tags.description: A dict of tags to apply to the subnet. Any tags currently applied to the subnet and not present here will be removed.

cidr.description: The CIDR block for the subnet. E.g. 10.0.0.0/16. Only required when state=present.

az.description: The availability zone for the subnet. Only required when state=present.

win_lineinfile.description:
This module will search a file for a line, and ensure that it is present or absent.
This is primarily useful when you want to change a single line in a file only.

name.description:
The path of the file to modify.
Note that the Windows path delimiter '' must be escaped as '\' (see examples below)

insertbefore.description:
Used with C(state=present). If specified, the line will be inserted before the last match of specified regular expression. A value is available; C(BOF) for inserting the line at the beginning of the file.
If specified regular expression has no matches, the line will be inserted at the end of the file.  May not be used with C(backrefs).

encoding.description:
Default: auto

Specifies the encoding of the source text file to operate on (and thus what the output encoding will be). The default of C(auto) will cause the module to auto-detect the encoding of the source file and ensure that the modified file is written with the same encoding.
An explicit encoding can be passed as a string that is a valid value to pass to the .NET framework System.Text.Encoding.GetEncoding() method - see U(https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.text.encoding%28v=vs.110%29.aspx).
This is mostly useful with C(create=yes) if you want to create a new file with a specific encoding. If C(create=yes) is specified without a specific encoding, the default encoding (UTF-8, no BOM) will be used.

dest.description:
The path of the file to modify.
Note that the Windows path delimiter '' must be escaped as '\' (see examples below)

create.description:
Default: no

Used with C(state=present). If specified, the file will be created if it does not already exist. By default it will fail if the file is missing.

newline.description:
Default: windows

Specifies the line separator style to use for the modified file. This defaults to the windows line separator ( ). Note that the indicated line separator will be used for file output regardless of the original line seperator that appears in the input file.

destfile.description:
The path of the file to modify.
Note that the Windows path delimiter '' must be escaped as '\' (see examples below)

backrefs.description:
Default: no

Used with C(state=present). If set, line can contain backreferences (both positional and named) that will get populated if the C(regexp) matches. This flag changes the operation of the module slightly; C(insertbefore) and C(insertafter) will be ignored, and if the C(regexp) doesn't match anywhere in the file, the file will be left unchanged.
If the C(regexp) does match, the last matching line will be replaced by the expanded line parameter.

state.description:
Default: present

Whether the line should be there or not.

insertafter.description:
Default: EOF

Used with C(state=present). If specified, the line will be inserted after the last match of specified regular expression. A special value is available; C(EOF) for inserting the line at the end of the file.
If specified regular expression has no matches, EOF will be used instead.  May not be used with C(backrefs).

regexp.description: The regular expression to look for in every line of the file. For C(state=present), the pattern to replace if found; only the last line found will be replaced. For C(state=absent), the pattern of the line to remove.  Uses .NET compatible regular expressions; see U(https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hs600312%28v=vs.110%29.aspx).

line.description: Required for C(state=present). The line to insert/replace into the file. If C(backrefs) is set, may contain backreferences that will get expanded with the C(regexp) capture groups if the regexp matches.

backup.description:
Default: no

Create a backup file including the timestamp information so you can get the original file back if you somehow clobbered it incorrectly.

validate.description:
Default: None

Validation to run before copying into place.  Use %s in the command to indicate the current file to validate.
The command is passed securely so shell features like expansion and pipes won't work.

clc_alert_policy.description: An Ansible module to Create or Delete Alert Policies at CenturyLink Cloud.

name.description:
Default: None

The name of the alert policy. This is mutually exclusive with id

metric.description:
Default: None

The metric on which to measure the condition that will trigger the alert. This is required for state 'present'

id.description:
Default: None

The alert policy id. This is mutually exclusive with name

alias.description: The alias of your CLC Account

state.description:
Default: present

Whether to create or delete the policy.

threshold.description:
Default: None

The threshold that will trigger the alert when the metric equals or exceeds it. This is required for state 'present' This number represents a percentage and must be a value between 5.0 - 95.0 that is a multiple of 5.0

alert_recipients.description:
Default: None

A list of recipient email ids to notify the alert. This is required for state 'present'

duration.description:
Default: None

The length of time in minutes that the condition must exceed the threshold. This is required for state 'present'

win_iis_virtualdirectory.description: Creates, Removes and configures a virtual directory in IIS.

application.description: The application under which the virtual directory is created or exists.

state.description:
Default: present

Whether to add or remove the specified virtual directory

name.description: The name of the virtual directory to create or remove

physical_path.description: The physical path to the folder in which the new virtual directory is created. The specified folder must already exist.

site.description: The site name under which the virtual directory is created or exists.

os_server.description: Create or Remove compute instances from OpenStack.

image.description: The name or id of the base image to boot.

image_exclude.description: Text to use to filter image names, for the case, such as HP, where there are multiple image names matching the common identifying portions. image_exclude is a negative match filter - it is text that may not exist in the image name. Defaults to "(deprecated)"

flavor_include.description: Text to use to filter flavor names, for the case, such as Rackspace, where there are multiple flavors that have the same ram count. flavor_include is a positive match filter - it must exist in the flavor name.

public_ip.description:
Default: yes

Ensure instance has public ip however the cloud wants to do that

meta.description:
Default: None

A list of key value pairs that should be provided as a metadata to the new instance or a string containing a list of key-value pairs. Eg:  meta: "key1=value1,key2=value2"

flavor.description:
Default: 1

The name or id of the flavor in which the new instance has to be created. Mutually exclusive with flavor_ram

security_groups.description:
Default: None

Names of the security groups to which the instance should be added. This may be a YAML list or a comma separated string.

scheduler_hints.description:
Default: None

Arbitrary key/value pairs to the scheduler for custom use

boot_from_volume.description: Should the instance boot from a persistent volume created based on the image given. Mututally exclusive with boot_volume.

userdata.description:
Default: None

Opaque blob of data which is made available to the instance

network.description:
Default: None

Name or ID of a network to attach this instance to. A simpler version of the nics parameter, only one of network or nics should be supplied.

nics.description:
Default: None

A list of networks to which the instance's interface should be attached. Networks may be referenced by net-id/net-name/port-id or port-name.
Also this accepts a string containing a list of (net/port)-(id/name) Eg: nics: "net-id=uuid-1,port-name=myport" Only one of network or nics should be supplied.

floating_ips.description:
Default: None

list of valid floating IPs that pre-exist to assign to this node

flavor_ram.description:
Default: 1

The minimum amount of ram in MB that the flavor in which the new instance has to be created must have. Mutually exclusive with flavor.

volume_size.description: The size of the volume to create in GB if booting from volume based on an image.

state.description:
Default: present

Should the resource be present or absent.

auto_ip.description:
Default: yes

Ensure instance has public ip however the cloud wants to do that

root_volume.description:
Default: None

Volume name or id to use as the volume to boot from. Implies boot_from_volume. Mutually exclusive with image and boot_from_volume.

config_drive.description:
Default: no

Whether to boot the server with config drive enabled

terminate_volume.description: If true, delete volume when deleting instance (if booted from volume)

key_name.description:
Default: None

The key pair name to be used when creating a instance

boot_volume.description:
Default: None

Volume name or id to use as the volume to boot from. Implies boot_from_volume. Mutually exclusive with image and boot_from_volume.

wait.description:
Default: yes

If the module should wait for the instance to be created.

name.description: Name that has to be given to the instance

auto_floating_ip.description:
Default: yes

Ensure instance has public ip however the cloud wants to do that

timeout.description:
Default: 180

The amount of time the module should wait for the instance to get into active state.

volumes.description: A list of preexisting volumes names or ids to attach to the instance

floating_ip_pools.description:
Default: None

Name of floating IP pool from which to choose a floating IP

crypttab.description: Control Linux encrypted block devices that are set up during system boot in C(/etc/crypttab).

name.description: Name of the encrypted block device as it appears in the C(/etc/crypttab) file, or optionaly prefixed with C(/dev/mapper/), as it appears in the filesystem. I(/dev/mapper/) will be stripped from I(name).

backing_device.description: Path to the underlying block device or file, or the UUID of a block-device prefixed with I(UUID=)

state.description: Use I(present) to add a line to C(/etc/crypttab) or update it's definition if already present. Use I(absent) to remove a line with matching I(name). Use I(opts_present) to add options to those already present; options with different values will be updated. Use I(opts_absent) to remove options from the existing set.

path.description:
Default: /etc/crypttab

Path to file to use instead of C(/etc/crypttab). This might be useful in a chroot environment.

password.description:
Default: none

Encryption password, the path to a file containing the pasword, or 'none' or '-' if the password should be entered at boot.

opts.description: A comma-delimited list of options. See C(crypttab(5) ) for details.

mime-type.description:

mime.description:

kubernetes.description: This module can manage Kubernetes resources on an existing cluster using the Kubernetes server API. Users can specify in-line API data, or specify an existing Kubernetes YAML file. Currently, this module, Only supports HTTP Basic Auth Only supports 'strategic merge' for update, http://goo.gl/fCPYxT SSL certs are not working, use 'validate_certs=off' to disable

username.description:
Default: admin

The HTTP Basic Auth username for the API I(endpoint). This should be set unless using the C('insecure') option.

url_password.description: The HTTP Basic Auth password for the API I(endpoint). This should be set unless using the C('insecure') option.

endpoint.description: The IPv4 API endpoint of the Kubernetes cluster.

certificate_authority_data.description: Certificate Authority data for Kubernetes server. Should be in either standard PEM format or base64 encoded PEM data. Note that certificate verification is broken until ansible supports a version of 'match_hostname' that can match the IP address against the CA data.

inline_data.description: The Kubernetes YAML data to send to the API I(endpoint). This option is mutually exclusive with C('file_reference').

insecure.description: Reverts the connection to using HTTP instead of HTTPS. This option should only be used when execuing the M('kubernetes') module local to the Kubernetes cluster using the insecure local port (locahost:8080 by default).

file_reference.description: Specify full path to a Kubernets YAML file to send to API I(endpoint). This option is mutually exclusive with C('inline_data').

api_endpoint.description: The IPv4 API endpoint of the Kubernetes cluster.

state.description:
Default: present

The desired action to take on the Kubernetes data.

url_username.description:
Default: admin

The HTTP Basic Auth username for the API I(endpoint). This should be set unless using the C('insecure') option.

password.description: The HTTP Basic Auth password for the API I(endpoint). This should be set unless using the C('insecure') option.

validate_certs.description: Enable/disable certificate validation. Note that this is set to C(false) until Ansible can support IP address based certificate hostname matching (exists in >= python3.5.0).

zypper.description: Manage packages on SUSE and openSUSE using the zypper and rpm tools.

name.description: package name or package specifier with version C(name) or C(name-1.0). You can also pass a url or a local path to a rpm file.

disable_gpg_check.description:
Default: no

Whether to disable to GPG signature checking of the package signature being installed. Has an effect only if state is I(present) or I(latest).

state.description:
Default: present

C(present) will make sure the package is installed. C(latest)  will make sure the latest version of the package is installed. C(absent)  will make sure the specified package is not installed.

pkg.description: package name or package specifier with version C(name) or C(name-1.0). You can also pass a url or a local path to a rpm file.

disable_recommends.description:
Default: yes

Corresponds to the C(--no-recommends) option for I(zypper). Default behavior (C(yes)) modifies zypper's default behavior; C(no) does install recommended packages.

type.description:
Default: package

The type of package to be operated on.

datatype.description:
Default: string

state.description:

data.description: Registry Value Data.  Binary data should be expressed a yaml byte array or as comma separated hex values.  An easy way to generate this is to run C(regedit.exe) and use the I(Export) option to save the registry values to a file.  In the exported file binary values will look like C(hex:be,ef,be,ef).  The C(hex:) prefix is optional.

value.description: Name of Registry Value

version.description: Specific version number of an image.

location.description: Azure location value (ie. westus, eastus, eastus2, northcentralus, etc.). Supplying only a location value will yield a list of available publishers for the location.

win_unzip.description: Unzips compressed files and archives. For extracting any compression types other than .zip, the PowerShellCommunityExtensions (PSCX) Module is required.  This module (in conjunction with PSCX) has the ability to recursively unzip files within the src zip file provided and also functionality for many other compression types. If the destination directory does not exist, it will be created before unzipping the file.  Specifying rm parameter will force removal of the src file after extraction.

dest.description: Destination of zip file (provide absolute path of directory). If it does not exist, the directory will be created.

src.description: File to be unzipped (provide absolute path)

recurse.description: Recursively expand zipped files within the src file.

creates.description: If this file or directory exists the specified src will not be extracted.

rm.description: Remove the zip file, after unzipping

nmcli.description: Manage the network devices. Create, modify, and manage, ethernet, teams, bonds, vlans etc.

conn_name.description: Where conn_name will be the name used to call the connection. when not provided a default name is generated: <type>[-<ifname>][-<num>]

ingress.description:
Default: None

This is only used with VLAN - VLAN ingress priority mapping

slavepriority.description:
Default: 32

This is only used with 'bridge-slave' - [<0-63>] - STP priority of this slave

path_cost.description:
Default: 100

This is only used with 'bridge-slave' - [<1-65535>] - STP port cost for destinations via this slave

vlandev.description:
Default: None

This is only used with VLAN - parent device this VLAN is on, can use ifname

forwarddelay.description:
Default: 15

This is only used with bridge - [forward-delay <2-30>] STP forwarding delay, in seconds

primary.description:
Default: None

This is only used with bond and is the primary interface name (for "active-backup" mode), this is the usually the 'ifname'

hairpin.description:
Default: True

This is only used with 'bridge-slave' - 'hairpin mode' for the slave, which allows frames to be sent back out through the slave the frame was received on.

egress.description:
Default: None

This is only used with VLAN - VLAN egress priority mapping

ageingtime.description:
Default: 300

This is only used with bridge - [ageing-time <0-1000000>] the Ethernet MAC address aging time, in seconds

mtu.description:
Default: 1500

The connection MTU, e.g. 9000. This can't be applied when creating the interface and is done once the interface has been created.
Can be used when modifying Team, VLAN, Ethernet (Future plans to implement wifi, pppoe, infiniband)

arp_ip_target.description:
Default: None

This is only used with bond - ARP IP target

maxage.description:
Default: 20

This is only used with bridge - [max-age <6-42>] STP maximum message age, in seconds

vlanid.description:
Default: None

This is only used with VLAN - VLAN ID in range <0-4095>

priority.description:
Default: 128

This is only used with 'bridge' - sets STP priority

gw4.description: The IPv4 gateway for this interface using this format ie: "192.168.100.1"

state.description: Whether the device should exist or not, taking action if the state is different from what is stated.

gw6.description:
Default: None

The IPv6 gateway for this interface using this format ie: "2001:db8::1"

master.description:
Default: None

master <master (ifname, or connection UUID or conn_name) of bridge, team, bond master connection profile.

flags.description:
Default: None

This is only used with VLAN - flags

ifname.description:
Default: conn_name

Where IFNAME will be the what we call the interface name.
interface to bind the connection to. The connection will only be applicable to this interface name.
A special value of "*" can be used for interface-independent connections.
The ifname argument is mandatory for all connection types except bond, team, bridge and vlan.

type.description: This is the type of device or network connection that you wish to create.

miimon.description:
Default: 100

This is only used with bond - miimon

hellotime.description:
Default: 2

This is only used with bridge - [hello-time <1-10>] STP hello time, in seconds

downdelay.description:
Default: None

This is only used with bond - downdelay

mac.description:
Default: None

This is only used with bridge - MAC address of the bridge (note: this requires a recent kernel feature, originally introduced in 3.15 upstream kernel)

ip6.description:
Default: None

The IPv6 address to this interface using this format ie: "abbe::cafe"

ip4.description:
Default: None

The IPv4 address to this interface using this format ie: "192.168.1.24/24"

autoconnect.description:
Default: yes

Whether the connection should start on boot.
Whether the connection profile can be automatically activated

dns6.description: A list of upto 3 dns servers, ipv6 format e.g. To add two IPv6 DNS server addresses: ["2001:4860:4860::8888 2001:4860:4860::8844"]

dns4.description:
Default: None

A list of upto 3 dns servers, ipv4 format e.g. To add two IPv4 DNS server addresses: ["8.8.8.8 8.8.4.4"]

arp_interval.description:
Default: None

This is only used with bond - ARP interval

stp.description:
Default: None

This is only used with bridge and controls whether Spanning Tree Protocol (STP) is enabled for this bridge

mode.description:
Default: balence-rr

This is the type of device or network connection that you wish to create for a bond, team or bridge.

updelay.description:
Default: None

This is only used with bond - updelay

state.description:
Default: present

state of the package

update_cache.description:
Default: no

update the package db first

name.description: name of package to install/remove

id.description: Numeric, the SSH key id you want to operate on.

dnsmadeeasy.description: Manages DNS records via the v2 REST API of the DNS Made Easy service.  It handles records only; there is no manipulation of domains or monitor/account support yet. See: U(http://www.dnsmadeeasy.com/services/rest-api/)

domain.description: Domain to work with. Can be the domain name (e.g. "mydomain.com") or the numeric ID of the domain in DNS Made Easy (e.g. "839989") for faster resolution.

record_name.description: Record name to get/create/delete/update. If record_name is not specified; all records for the domain will be returned in "result" regardless of the state argument.

record_ttl.description:
Default: 1800

record's "Time to live".  Number of seconds the record remains cached in DNS servers.

state.description: whether the record should exist or not

record_value.description:
Record value. HTTPRED: <redirection URL>, MX: <priority> <target name>, NS: <name server>, PTR: <target name>, SRV: <priority> <weight> <port> <target name>, TXT: <text value>
If record_value is not specified; no changes will be made and the record will be returned in 'result' (in other words, this module can be used to fetch a record's current id, type, and ttl)

validate_certs.description:
Default: yes

If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

monit.description: Manage the state of a program monitored via I(Monit)

state.description: The state of service

name.description: The name of the I(monit) program/process to manage

timeout.description:
Default: 300

If there are pending actions for the service monitored by monit, then Ansible will check for up to this many seconds to verify the the requested action has been performed. Ansible will sleep for five seconds between each check.

datadog_monitor.description:
Manages monitors within Datadog
Options like described on http://docs.datadoghq.com/api/

notify_audit.description: A boolean indicating whether tagged users will be notified on changes to this monitor.

name.description: The name of the alert.

silenced.description: Dictionary of scopes to timestamps or None. Each scope will be muted until the given POSIX timestamp or forever if the value is None.

no_data_timeframe.description:
Default: 2x timeframe for metric, 2 minutes for service

The number of minutes before a monitor will notify when data stops reporting. Must be at least 2x the monitor timeframe for metric alerts or 2 minutes for service checks.

notify_no_data.description: A boolean indicating whether this monitor will notify when data stops reporting..

renotify_interval.description: The number of minutes after the last notification before a monitor will re-notify on the current status. It will only re-notify if it's not resolved.

state.description: The designated state of the monitor.

escalation_message.description: A message to include with a re-notification. Supports the '@username' notification we allow elsewhere. Not applicable if renotify_interval is None

query.description: The monitor query to notify on with syntax varying depending on what type of monitor you are creating.

message.description: A message to include with notifications for this monitor. Email notifications can be sent to specific users by using the same '@username' notation as events.

type.description:
The type of the monitor.
The 'event alert'is available starting at Ansible 2.1

thresholds.description:
Default: {'warning': 1, 'ok': 1, 'critical': 1}

A dictionary of thresholds by status. This option is only available for service checks and metric alerts. Because each of them can have multiple thresholds, we don't define them directly in the query.

timeout_h.description: The number of hours of the monitor not reporting data before it will automatically resolve from a triggered state.

azure_rm_virtualnetwork.description: Create, update or delete a virtual networks. Allows setting and updating the available IPv4 address ranges and setting custom DNS servers. Use the azure_rm_subnet module to associate subnets with a virtual network.

dns_servers.description: Custom list of DNS servers. Maximum length of two. The first server in the list will be treated as the Primary server. This is an explicit list. Existing DNS servers will be replaced with the specified list. Use the purge_dns_servers option to remove all custom DNS servers and revert to default Azure servers.

name.description: name of the virtual network.

location.description:
Default: resource_group location

Valid azure location. Defaults to location of the resource group.

state.description:
Default: present

Assert the state of the virtual network. Use 'present' to create or update and 'absent' to delete.

address_prefixes_cidr.description: List of IPv4 address ranges where each is formatted using CIDR notation. Required when creating a new virtual network or using purge_address_prefixes.

purge_dns_servers.description: Use with state present to remove existing DNS servers, reverting to default Azure servers. Mutually exclusive with dns_servers.

purge_address_prefixes.description: Use with state present to remove any existing address_prefixes.

address_prefixes.description: List of IPv4 address ranges where each is formatted using CIDR notation. Required when creating a new virtual network or using purge_address_prefixes.

clc_server_snapshot.description: An Ansible module to Create, Delete and Restore server snapshots in CenturyLink Cloud.

server_ids.description: The list of CLC server Ids.

expiration_days.description:
Default: 7

The number of days to keep the server snapshot before it expires.

state.description:
Default: present

The state to insure that the provided resources are in.

wait.description:
Default: True

Whether to wait for the provisioning tasks to finish before returning.
